commit_list.message:
Fix the logic for pry-rails dependency checking

The check was just backwards so I made the name of the method more explicit
and changed the if to an unless.
Exclude devise :timedout from flash messages

Adds ability to suppress scope count on a per-scope basis

Suppress scope count on the index page by passing :show_count => false to
a scope definition.

Fix mismatching variable names when using an underscore

The ERBTracker template digest helper class was using a regex to match
render calls and it was incorrectly not matching against variables with
underscores in the name. This caused it to use the wrong regex match data
to populate the template dependency. Because underscore is a valid
character for a variable, this fixes the ERBTracker to match it properly.

Cleanup CacheHelper changes allowing opt-out of cache digests

Instead of deleting the skip_digest option flag, this changes the method to merely check the
key. This change is because of a discussion in this thread:

https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/8317

This commit also makes #fragment_name_with_digest private due to its
functionality being subsumed by #cache_fragment_name.
Add CHANGELOG entry for opt-out option of automatic template digesting

Add explicit opt-out for fragment cache digesting

This add support for sending an explicit opt-out of the "Russian-doll"
cache digest feature on a case-by-case basis. This is useful when cache-
expiration needs to be performed manually and it would be otherwise
difficult to know the exact name of a digested cache key.

More information: https://github.com/rails/cache_digests/pull/16

Consolidate newlines in exception messages to avoid blank output

The exception message will now have leading newlines removed to avoid
displaying a blank message as a header.

commit_list.message:
Add alternate ActiveRecord Daemon store for use with Oracle

Oracle does not allow an ORDER clause when using FOR UPDATE so this store
achieves the same locking without ordering in SQL.

For lack of a config variable, this custom store can be activated by
placing the following at the end of the rpush initializer provided you
are already using ActiveRecord client.

require 'rpush/daemon/store/oracle'
Rpush::Daemon.store = Rpush::Daemon::Store::Oracle.new

commit_list.message:
Fix issue with attempting to write to a nil session store

It is possible and valid to have no session store configured (e.g. when
using warden from a purely API-accessed app). SessionSerializer throws
an exception if a rack session does not exist due to trying to access it.
This changes the session to be injected to SessionSerializer and defaults
it to a hash if no session exists (basically a NullSession). Fixes
https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/2065

Display Enum fields as Strings instead of Numbers

Problem:

ActiveRecord enums are integers in the database,
but ActiveRecord translates them into the associated string value
before returning them to Rails application code.

The administrate generator interprets Enums as integers by default,
which means that any generated dashboards with enums error
unless you manually change the attribute type to Field::String.

Solution:

When generating a dashboard class for an ActiveRecord model,
inspect the class to see if it has defined enums
per the ActiveRecord 4.1+ API.
If the column in question is an Enum,
by default interpret it as a String field that is not searchable.

As a follow-up task, we can define a custom field
for Enums that supports searching and other operations.

Add specs for Administrate::Search class

PR #317

Problem:

At the moment, search functionality
is only covered at the feature level;
there are no unit tests for the `Administrate::Search` class.

It is difficult to extend search functionality
without first having good test coverage
for the `Administrate::Search` class.

Solution:

Add unit tests for `Administrate::Search`

commit_list.message:
Introduce BaseSanitizer null sanitizer and controller-specific callbacks

This updates Devise's StrongParameter support to feature:

- A Null base sanitizer to support existing Rails 3.x installations that
  don't want to use StrongParameters yet
- A new, simpler API for ParameterSanitizer: #permit, #permit!, and #forbid
- Overrideable callbacks on a controller-basis, e.g. #create_sessions_params
  for passing the current scope's parameters through StrongParameters and
  a helper method, whitelisted_params, for rolling your own implementations
  of #create_x_params in your own controllers.
- Lots of tests!

commit_list.message:
Add support for Rails 4 strong_parameters

This brings support for Rails 4 StrongParameters changes.

- Parameter sanitizing is setup for Devise controllers via
  resource_params except Omniauth Callbacks which doesn't use
  resource_params.

- Change #build_resource to not call resource_params for get requests.
  Parameter sanitizing is only needed when params are posted to the
  server so there's no need to try to construct resource params on get
  requests (new, edit).

commit_list.message:
Fix issue with attempting to write to a nil session store

It is possible and valid to have no session store configured (e.g. when
using warden from a purely API-accessed app). SessionSerializer throws
an exception if a rack session does not exist due to trying to access it.
This changes the session to be injected to SessionSerializer and defaults
it to a hash if no session exists (basically a NullSession). Fixes
https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/2065
commit_list.repo_description: This is a forked version of Warden 1.2.3.

commit_list.message:
Fix mismatching variable names when using an underscore

The ERBTracker template digest helper class was using a regex to match
render calls and it was incorrectly not matching against variables with
underscores in the name. This caused it to use the wrong regex match data
to populate the template dependency. Because underscore is a valid
character for a variable, this fixes the ERBTracker to match it properly.

Cleanup CacheHelper changes allowing opt-out of cache digests

Instead of deleting the skip_digest option flag, this changes the method to merely check the
key. This change is because of a discussion in this thread:

https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/8317

This commit also makes #fragment_name_with_digest private due to its
functionality being subsumed by #cache_fragment_name.
Add CHANGELOG entry for opt-out option of automatic template digesting

Add explicit opt-out for fragment cache digesting

This add support for sending an explicit opt-out of the "Russian-doll"
cache digest feature on a case-by-case basis. This is useful when cache-
expiration needs to be performed manually and it would be otherwise
difficult to know the exact name of a digested cache key.

More information: https://github.com/rails/cache_digests/pull/16

character for a variable, this fixes the ERBTracker to match it properly.

commit_list.message:
Introduce BaseSanitizer null sanitizer and controller-specific callbacks

This updates Devise's StrongParameter support to feature:

- A Null base sanitizer to support existing Rails 3.x installations that
  don't want to use StrongParameters yet
- A new, simpler API for ParameterSanitizer: #permit, #permit!, and #forbid
- Overrideable callbacks on a controller-basis, e.g. #create_sessions_params
  for passing the current scope's parameters through StrongParameters and
  a helper method, whitelisted_params, for rolling your own implementations
  of #create_x_params in your own controllers.
- Lots of tests!
commit_list.repo_description: devise-tyg-custom

commit_list.message:
Add support for Rails 4 strong_parameters

This brings support for Rails 4 StrongParameters changes.

- Parameter sanitizing is setup for Devise controllers via
  resource_params except Omniauth Callbacks which doesn't use
  resource_params.

- Change #build_resource to not call resource_params for get requests.
  Parameter sanitizing is only needed when params are posted to the
  server so there's no need to try to construct resource params on get
  requests (new, edit).

commit_list.message:
Fix mismatching variable names when using an underscore

The ERBTracker template digest helper class was using a regex to match
render calls and it was incorrectly not matching against variables with
underscores in the name. This caused it to use the wrong regex match data
to populate the template dependency. Because underscore is a valid
character for a variable, this fixes the ERBTracker to match it properly.

Cleanup CacheHelper changes allowing opt-out of cache digests

Instead of deleting the skip_digest option flag, this changes the method to merely check the
key. This change is because of a discussion in this thread:

https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/8317

This commit also makes #fragment_name_with_digest private due to its
functionality being subsumed by #cache_fragment_name.
Add CHANGELOG entry for opt-out option of automatic template digesting

Add explicit opt-out for fragment cache digesting

This add support for sending an explicit opt-out of the "Russian-doll"
cache digest feature on a case-by-case basis. This is useful when cache-
expiration needs to be performed manually and it would be otherwise
difficult to know the exact name of a digested cache key.

More information: https://github.com/rails/cache_digests/pull/16

commit_list.message:
Display Enum fields as Strings instead of Numbers

Problem:

ActiveRecord enums are integers in the database,
but ActiveRecord translates them into the associated string value
before returning them to Rails application code.

The administrate generator interprets Enums as integers by default,
which means that any generated dashboards with enums error
unless you manually change the attribute type to Field::String.

Solution:

When generating a dashboard class for an ActiveRecord model,
inspect the class to see if it has defined enums
per the ActiveRecord 4.1+ API.
If the column in question is an Enum,
by default interpret it as a String field that is not searchable.

As a follow-up task, we can define a custom field
for Enums that supports searching and other operations.
commit_list.repo_description: A Rails engine that helps you put together a super-flexible admin dashboard.

commit_list.message:
Add specs for Administrate::Search class

PR #317

Problem:

At the moment, search functionality
is only covered at the feature level;
there are no unit tests for the `Administrate::Search` class.

It is difficult to extend search functionality
without first having good test coverage
for the `Administrate::Search` class.

Solution:

Add unit tests for `Administrate::Search`

commit_list.message:
Fix mismatching variable names when using an underscore

The ERBTracker template digest helper class was using a regex to match
render calls and it was incorrectly not matching against variables with
underscores in the name. This caused it to use the wrong regex match data
to populate the template dependency. Because underscore is a valid
character for a variable, this fixes the ERBTracker to match it properly.

Cleanup CacheHelper changes allowing opt-out of cache digests

Instead of deleting the skip_digest option flag, this changes the method to merely check the
key. This change is because of a discussion in this thread:

https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/8317

This commit also makes #fragment_name_with_digest private due to its
functionality being subsumed by #cache_fragment_name.
Add CHANGELOG entry for opt-out option of automatic template digesting

Add explicit opt-out for fragment cache digesting

This add support for sending an explicit opt-out of the "Russian-doll"
cache digest feature on a case-by-case basis. This is useful when cache-
expiration needs to be performed manually and it would be otherwise
difficult to know the exact name of a digested cache key.

More information: https://github.com/rails/cache_digests/pull/16

Fix issue with not matching renders when using an underscore

This fixes #50. The regex being used to match render calls was incorrectly
not matching against variables with underscores in the name and so it was
using the wrong regex match data to populate the template dependency.
Because underscore is a valid character for a variable, this fixes the
ERBTracker to match it properly.

Add skip_digest option key to allow bypassing cache digestion

In addition to the already present bypass method of passing an explicitly
version numbered cache key (e.g. ['v1','cache-key']), this adds an option
to the cache in order to give control in bypassing the digest append step
on a case-by-case basis.

Adds ability to suppress scope count on a per-scope basis

Suppress scope count on the index page by passing :show_count => false to
a scope definition.

commit_list.message:
Update README.md

As of Rails 4.2, Rails now supports foreign key constraints!

Fix mismatching variable names when using an underscore

The ERBTracker template digest helper class was using a regex to match
render calls and it was incorrectly not matching against variables with
underscores in the name. This caused it to use the wrong regex match data
to populate the template dependency. Because underscore is a valid
character for a variable, this fixes the ERBTracker to match it properly.
commit_list.repo_description: Fork of rails/rails

commit_list.message:
Cleanup CacheHelper changes allowing opt-out of cache digests

Instead of deleting the skip_digest option flag, this changes the method to merely check the
key. This change is because of a discussion in this thread:

https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/8317

This commit also makes #fragment_name_with_digest private due to its
functionality being subsumed by #cache_fragment_name.

commit_list.repo_description: Fork of rails/rails

commit_list.message:
Add explicit opt-out for fragment cache digesting

This add support for sending an explicit opt-out of the "Russian-doll"
cache digest feature on a case-by-case basis. This is useful when cache-
expiration needs to be performed manually and it would be otherwise
difficult to know the exact name of a digested cache key.

More information: https://github.com/rails/cache_digests/pull/16

commit_list.message:
Support rspec 3.0+ out of the box

Rspec 3.0 introduces separate _helper files for full tests and tests that
don't require the full rails app to be loaded. Because of this and because
the point of zeus is to pre-load your app, default to loading the full
rails_helper for zeus. You can override this behavior with the env var
RAILS_TEST_HELPER.

Fixes #474

Add hugely hacked together make command for building only Linux gems

The default make command tries to make the darwin version of the gem which
will not work on linux due to the absence of XCode. This adds back a make
linux command to allow building just the linux binaries.

Fix issue with test names not escaping special characters

(namely ? and other symbols important for regular expressions), the test
runner fails to match because the symbols aren't escaped.

Call respond_to?(attr) before applying strip or downcase

This avoids calling strip and downcase on globally configured keys that may
not exist on all devise models. Fixes #2204, a regression introduced by
PR #2135. Also included a note about the intentional use of respond_to.

commit_list.message:
Introduce BaseSanitizer null sanitizer and controller-specific callbacks

This updates Devise's StrongParameter support to feature:

- A Null base sanitizer to support existing Rails 3.x installations that
  don't want to use StrongParameters yet
- A new, simpler API for ParameterSanitizer: #permit, #permit!, and #forbid
- Overrideable callbacks on a controller-basis, e.g. #create_sessions_params
  for passing the current scope's parameters through StrongParameters and
  a helper method, whitelisted_params, for rolling your own implementations
  of #create_x_params in your own controllers.
- Lots of tests!

Change parameter sanitizer instance method to scope to devise

run into any naming collisions with user code.

commit_list.message:
Add support for Rails 4 strong_parameters

This brings support for Rails 4 StrongParameters changes.

- Parameter sanitizing is setup for Devise controllers via
  resource_params except Omniauth Callbacks which doesn't use
  resource_params.

- Change #build_resource to not call resource_params for get requests.
  Parameter sanitizing is only needed when params are posted to the
  server so there's no need to try to construct resource params on get
  requests (new, edit).

commit_list.message:
Fix mismatching variable names when using an underscore

The ERBTracker template digest helper class was using a regex to match
render calls and it was incorrectly not matching against variables with
underscores in the name. This caused it to use the wrong regex match data
to populate the template dependency. Because underscore is a valid
character for a variable, this fixes the ERBTracker to match it properly.

Cleanup CacheHelper changes allowing opt-out of cache digests

Instead of deleting the skip_digest option flag, this changes the method to merely check the
key. This change is because of a discussion in this thread:

https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/8317

This commit also makes #fragment_name_with_digest private due to its
functionality being subsumed by #cache_fragment_name.
Add CHANGELOG entry for opt-out option of automatic template digesting

Add explicit opt-out for fragment cache digesting

This add support for sending an explicit opt-out of the "Russian-doll"
cache digest feature on a case-by-case basis. This is useful when cache-
expiration needs to be performed manually and it would be otherwise
difficult to know the exact name of a digested cache key.

More information: https://github.com/rails/cache_digests/pull/16

Display Enum fields as Strings instead of Numbers

Problem:

ActiveRecord enums are integers in the database,
but ActiveRecord translates them into the associated string value
before returning them to Rails application code.

The administrate generator interprets Enums as integers by default,
which means that any generated dashboards with enums error
unless you manually change the attribute type to Field::String.

Solution:

When generating a dashboard class for an ActiveRecord model,
inspect the class to see if it has defined enums
per the ActiveRecord 4.1+ API.

by default interpret it as a String field that is not searchable.

As a follow-up task, we can define a custom field
for Enums that supports searching and other operations.

Add alternate ActiveRecord Daemon store for use with Oracle

Oracle does not allow an ORDER clause when using FOR UPDATE so this store
achieves the same locking without ordering in SQL.

For lack of a config variable, this custom store can be activated by
placing the following at the end of the rpush initializer provided you
are already using ActiveRecord client.

require 'rpush/daemon/store/oracle'
Rpush::Daemon.store = Rpush::Daemon::Store::Oracle.new

commit_list.message:
Fix issue with attempting to write to a nil session store

It is possible and valid to have no session store configured (e.g. when
using warden from a purely API-accessed app). SessionSerializer throws
an exception if a rack session does not exist due to trying to access it.
This changes the session to be injected to SessionSerializer and defaults
it to a hash if no session exists (basically a NullSession). Fixes
https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/2065

ActiveRecord enums are integers in the database,

Introduce BaseSanitizer null sanitizer and controller-specific callbacks

This updates Devise's StrongParameter support to feature:

- A Null base sanitizer to support existing Rails 3.x installations that
  don't want to use StrongParameters yet
- A new, simpler API for ParameterSanitizer: #permit, #permit!, and #forbid
- Overrideable callbacks on a controller-basis, e.g. #create_sessions_params
  for passing the current scope's parameters through StrongParameters and
  a helper method, whitelisted_params, for rolling your own implementations
  of #create_x_params in your own controllers.
- Lots of tests!

Change parameter sanitizer instance method to scope to devise

This way it's very explicit that this method is for devise and it won't
run into any naming collisions with user code.
Remove MassAssignment security from Mongoid test shim
Fix internal helper test referencing resource_params

Add support for Rails 4 strong_parameters

This brings support for Rails 4 StrongParameters changes.

- Parameter sanitizing is setup for Devise controllers via
  resource_params except Omniauth Callbacks which doesn't use
  resource_params.

- Change #build_resource to not call resource_params for get requests.
  Parameter sanitizing is only needed when params are posted to the
  server so there's no need to try to construct resource params on get
  requests (new, edit).

Remove mass-assignment role-based tests, no longer supported in Rails 4

Mass-assignment security roles are removed in Rails 4 so there's no need
to test :as => :role behavior.

commit_list.message:
Fix the logic for pry-rails dependency checking

The check was just backwards so I made the name of the method more explicit
and changed the if to an unless.

Adds ability to suppress scope count on a per-scope basis

Suppress scope count on the index page by passing :show_count => false to
a scope definition.

Fix the logic for pry-rails dependency checking

The check was just backwards so I made the name of the method more explicit
and changed the if to an unless.

Adds ability to suppress scope count on a per-scope basis

Suppress scope count on the index page by passing :show_count => false to
a scope definition.

Cleanup CacheHelper changes allowing opt-out of cache digests

Instead of deleting the skip_digest option flag, this changes the method to merely check the
key. This change is because of a discussion in this thread:

https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/8317

This commit also makes #fragment_name_with_digest private due to its
functionality being subsumed by #cache_fragment_name.
Add CHANGELOG entry for opt-out option of automatic template digesting

Add explicit opt-out for fragment cache digesting

This add support for sending an explicit opt-out of the "Russian-doll"
cache digest feature on a case-by-case basis. This is useful when cache-
expiration needs to be performed manually and it would be otherwise
difficult to know the exact name of a digested cache key.

More information: https://github.com/rails/cache_digests/pull/16

Fix mismatching variable names when using an underscore

The ERBTracker template digest helper class was using a regex to match
render calls and it was incorrectly not matching against variables with
underscores in the name. This caused it to use the wrong regex match data
to populate the template dependency. Because underscore is a valid
character for a variable, this fixes the ERBTracker to match it properly.

commit_list.message:
Remove hacks around Minitest internals, make use of Minitest.autorun

Instead of trying to hack around Minitest internals, we'll simply hook into
the way that they internally call Minitest.run(ARGV) by replacing ARGV with
our desired test arguments. This is arguably a hack because we're mangling
ARGV but Minitest has executed with ARGV explicitly passed in for at least
two major releases so we'll go with it for now.

commit_list.message:
Support rspec 3.0+ out of the box

Rspec 3.0 introduces separate _helper files for full tests and tests that
don't require the full rails app to be loaded. Because of this and because
the point of zeus is to pre-load your app, default to loading the full
rails_helper for zeus. You can override this behavior with the env var
RAILS_TEST_HELPER.

Fixes #474

commit_list.message:
Introduce BaseSanitizer null sanitizer and controller-specific callbacks

This updates Devise's StrongParameter support to feature:

- A Null base sanitizer to support existing Rails 3.x installations that
  don't want to use StrongParameters yet
- A new, simpler API for ParameterSanitizer: #permit, #permit!, and #forbid
- Overrideable callbacks on a controller-basis, e.g. #create_sessions_params
  for passing the current scope's parameters through StrongParameters and
  a helper method, whitelisted_params, for rolling your own implementations
  of #create_x_params in your own controllers.
- Lots of tests!

commit_list.message:
Add support for Rails 4 strong_parameters

This brings support for Rails 4 StrongParameters changes.

- Parameter sanitizing is setup for Devise controllers via
  resource_params except Omniauth Callbacks which doesn't use
  resource_params.

- Change #build_resource to not call resource_params for get requests.
  Parameter sanitizing is only needed when params are posted to the
  server so there's no need to try to construct resource params on get
  requests (new, edit).

commit_list.message:
Fix mismatching variable names when using an underscore

The ERBTracker template digest helper class was using a regex to match
render calls and it was incorrectly not matching against variables with
underscores in the name. This caused it to use the wrong regex match data
to populate the template dependency. Because underscore is a valid
character for a variable, this fixes the ERBTracker to match it properly.

commit_list.message:
Cleanup CacheHelper changes allowing opt-out of cache digests

Instead of deleting the skip_digest option flag, this changes the method to merely check the
key. This change is because of a discussion in this thread:

https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/8317

This commit also makes #fragment_name_with_digest private due to its
functionality being subsumed by #cache_fragment_name.

commit_list.message:
Add explicit opt-out for fragment cache digesting

This add support for sending an explicit opt-out of the "Russian-doll"
cache digest feature on a case-by-case basis. This is useful when cache-
expiration needs to be performed manually and it would be otherwise
difficult to know the exact name of a digested cache key.

commit_list.message:
Display Enum fields as Strings instead of Numbers

Problem:

ActiveRecord enums are integers in the database,
but ActiveRecord translates them into the associated string value
before returning them to Rails application code.

The administrate generator interprets Enums as integers by default,
which means that any generated dashboards with enums error
unless you manually change the attribute type to Field::String.

Solution:

When generating a dashboard class for an ActiveRecord model,
inspect the class to see if it has defined enums
per the ActiveRecord 4.1+ API.
If the column in question is an Enum,
by default interpret it as a String field that is not searchable.

As a follow-up task, we can define a custom field
for Enums that supports searching and other operations.
commit_list.repo_description: A repositry where I test the administrate field plugins that I use, using the administrate example project.

commit_list.message:
Add specs for Administrate::Search class

PR #317

Problem:

At the moment, search functionality
is only covered at the feature level;
there are no unit tests for the `Administrate::Search` class.

It is difficult to extend search functionality
without first having good test coverage
for the `Administrate::Search` class.

Solution:

Add unit tests for `Administrate::Search`

commit_list.repo_description: Flexible authentication solution for Rails with Warden.

commit_list.message:
Introduce BaseSanitizer null sanitizer and controller-specific callbacks

This updates Devise's StrongParameter support to feature:

- A Null base sanitizer to support existing Rails 3.x installations that
  don't want to use StrongParameters yet
- A new, simpler API for ParameterSanitizer: #permit, #permit!, and #forbid
- Overrideable callbacks on a controller-basis, e.g. #create_sessions_params
  for passing the current scope's parameters through StrongParameters and
  a helper method, whitelisted_params, for rolling your own implementations
  of #create_x_params in your own controllers.
- Lots of tests!

run into any naming collisions with user code.

commit_list.message:
Add support for Rails 4 strong_parameters

This brings support for Rails 4 StrongParameters changes.

- Parameter sanitizing is setup for Devise controllers via
  resource_params except Omniauth Callbacks which doesn't use
  resource_params.

- Change #build_resource to not call resource_params for get requests.
  Parameter sanitizing is only needed when params are posted to the
  server so there's no need to try to construct resource params on get
  requests (new, edit).

commit_list.message:
Cleanup CacheHelper changes allowing opt-out of cache digests

Instead of deleting the skip_digest option flag, this changes the method to merely check the
key. This change is because of a discussion in this thread:

https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/8317

This commit also makes #fragment_name_with_digest private due to its
functionality being subsumed by #cache_fragment_name.
commit_list.repo_description: existing-rails-from-abc

commit_list.message: Add CHANGELOG entry for opt-out option of automatic template digesting
commit_list.repo_description: existing-rails-from-abc

commit_list.message:
Add explicit opt-out for fragment cache digesting

This add support for sending an explicit opt-out of the "Russian-doll"
cache digest feature on a case-by-case basis. This is useful when cache-
expiration needs to be performed manually and it would be otherwise
difficult to know the exact name of a digested cache key.

More information: https://github.com/rails/cache_digests/pull/16
commit_list.repo_description: existing-rails-from-abc

commit_list.message:
Fix mismatching variable names when using an underscore

The ERBTracker template digest helper class was using a regex to match
render calls and it was incorrectly not matching against variables with
underscores in the name. This caused it to use the wrong regex match data
to populate the template dependency. Because underscore is a valid
character for a variable, this fixes the ERBTracker to match it properly.
commit_list.repo_description: existing-rails-from-abc

commit_list.message:
Cleanup CacheHelper changes allowing opt-out of cache digests

Instead of deleting the skip_digest option flag, this changes the method to merely check the
key. This change is because of a discussion in this thread:

https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/8317

This commit also makes #fragment_name_with_digest private due to its
functionality being subsumed by #cache_fragment_name.
Add CHANGELOG entry for opt-out option of automatic template digesting

Add explicit opt-out for fragment cache digesting

This add support for sending an explicit opt-out of the "Russian-doll"
cache digest feature on a case-by-case basis. This is useful when cache-
expiration needs to be performed manually and it would be otherwise
difficult to know the exact name of a digested cache key.

More information: https://github.com/rails/cache_digests/pull/16

Fix mismatching variable names when using an underscore

The ERBTracker template digest helper class was using a regex to match
render calls and it was incorrectly not matching against variables with
underscores in the name. This caused it to use the wrong regex match data
to populate the template dependency. Because underscore is a valid
character for a variable, this fixes the ERBTracker to match it properly.

Fix improper login param sanitization permit

This includes a failing test case that hooks into ActiveSupport
Notifications to catch the param permit error.

Introduce BaseSanitizer null sanitizer and controller-specific callbacks

This updates Devise's StrongParameter support to feature:

- A Null base sanitizer to support existing Rails 3.x installations that
  don't want to use StrongParameters yet
- A new, simpler API for ParameterSanitizer: #permit, #permit!, and #forbid
- Overrideable callbacks on a controller-basis, e.g. #create_sessions_params
  for passing the current scope's parameters through StrongParameters and
  a helper method, whitelisted_params, for rolling your own implementations
  of #create_x_params in your own controllers.
- Lots of tests!

Remove mass-assignment role-based tests, no longer supported in Rails 4

Mass-assignment security roles are removed in Rails 4 so there's no need
to test :as => :role behavior.
Remove protected_attributes gem and all whitelisting

Add test for Issue #2190

Seems to be passing for me.
Fix #1994 Lockable no longer leaks account existence

Unit test for Lockable#unauthenticated_message not leaking account existence

This is another failing test for #1994, a unit test for Lockable. Lockable's
#uanauthenticated_message should not return :locked if paranoid mode is on
and instead should return the generic :invalid response.

Add failing test for Issue #1994

Lockable should not leak information about account existence if paranoid
mode is on.
Add test for #devise_i18n_options allowing resource_name override

Make #set_flash_message respect i18n-set resource_name

Using #devise_i18n_options allows overriding any i18n keys but the
resulting call to I18n.t does not respect an override of resource_name.

Change parameter sanitizer instance method to scope to devise

This way it's very explicit that this method is for devise and it won't
run into any naming collisions with user code.
Remove MassAssignment security from Mongoid test shim
Fix internal helper test referencing resource_params

Add support for Rails 4 strong_parameters

This brings support for Rails 4 StrongParameters changes.

- Parameter sanitizing is setup for Devise controllers via
  resource_params except Omniauth Callbacks which doesn't use
  resource_params.

- Change #build_resource to not call resource_params for get requests.
  Parameter sanitizing is only needed when params are posted to the
  server so there's no need to try to construct resource params on get
  requests (new, edit).

Call respond_to?(attr) before applying strip or downcase

This avoids calling strip and downcase on globally configured keys that may
not exist on all devise models. Fixes #2204, a regression introduced by
PR #2135. Also included a note about the intentional use of respond_to.

Add failing tests for Issue #2204

For a point release upgrade, Devise should not throw an exception when trying
to downcase or strip globally configured keys. This would be a breaking
change in functionality and this test demonstrates the issue.
